This place is freakin' awesome  OMG.  It's like their sprinkle their fries with cocaine as a seasoning.  They're sooooooooo good.  Especially dipped in cheese.  I especially love the buffalo chicken philly sandwich.  It's chicken, hot sauce, spicy blue cheese and celery all melted together in bread.  YUM.  I would like to try everything they have on their menu.  It's awesome.

I have eaten here a few times on my trips to phoenix and I have to say that this is the best cheesesteak I have ever eaten.   Fast and friendly service and great food. The rolls that the steak comes on are really really good and the meat with the cheese whiz is great. I love this place and there sweet potato frys.  If you want a great experience come here!!!!!

As a teen, I work at a Philly hoagie shop and this is one of the best I have had since then.  I do get a bit freaked out on the cheesewhiz, so provolone it is for me. Mushrooms, onions, and jalapenos. They put cheese on the meat and bread on top for the flip(the heat softens the bread). Fries & sauce was good too! Staff was polite and nice. Price is good for the quality and quantity of what we got.. ended up in a food coma.  Will come back everytime we are on this side of town!
I am not big on cheesesteaks. Okay, let me rephrase. I was not big on cheesesteaks. Where were these my whole life?!?! One of the best sandwiches I have ever eaten. I will definitely be back!
Excellent authentic cheesesteak sandwiches! Every bite is better than the first!  Fresh salads with homemade dressings. Love this place!

Seriously so good! I got the cheesesteak with cheese wiz and onions with a side of sweet potato fries and it was delicious!! You have to come by here and try it out!! So bomb!   By the way, service here is awesome too. Check them out!

I give this place 5 stars because I don't know of any other places with good Philly cheese steak sammiches. Their cheese steak with whiz is great as is the chicken Reuben cheese steak. There is also a good amount of meat in their sandwiches and the bread is soft and fresh. I personally think the regular size is enough for me. I love their fry sauce and their sweet potato fries. Their regular fries are not anything to get excited about though. Prices are decent and the service is quick as well
I could take it or leave it. I do think "Gourmet" is false advertising.  Cheesesteaks really aren't my thing to begin with so y'all can take my review with a grain of salt.

Best cheesesteaks around! The sweet potato fries are tasty and go deliciously with the meal. Order with a side of fries and they throw in a drink. Can't go wrong. The chicken buffalo style is a favorite. I order for our department lunch about once a month. Call in your order, I was told someone is there at 6AM! This way they can have it ready when you arrive.

Wow.  This was an awesome cheese steak.  The menu is really simple but if you want cheese steak this is it.  The cheese steaks were delicious and the service was great.  I don't live on this side of town but when out shopping near by i will be back for more.

Clean, friendly staff, and freaking delicious food! Go here, thank me later! I got a mini cheesesteak with white American (wish I would have gotten cheese wiz), onions, and bell peppers. I got the Jalapeño cilantro ranch on the side, and dipped my fries and my cheesesteak in it. Yum!!

This place is the shit for Cheesesteak in the Phoenix/Tempe area, I am not sure there is anything that could match it! I always get the phili original w/ grilled onions, you know the works. The prices are a little high, from what I recall, 8$ for a 6 inch, and I always get fries because their fry sauce is simply amazing, so Ill spend around $13 if I get the 6 inch meal which comes with fries and a drink. Their condiments are all fresh tasting (banana peppers, etc) and atmosphere and decor is modern looking.   Staff is very friendly and service is quick. I highly recommend checking this place out if you dont mind paying a little on the expensive end for cheesesteaks.

This restaurant is my guilty pleasure! The Cheesesteaks... Are AMAZING! They are so good that I usually end up eating the wrapper after I'm done lol. I have been to Pat's and Geno's in Philadelphia and I have to say that Forefathers are almost better then the original cheesesteak restaurants. You must get the Cheese Wiz on your steak it's a MUST!
The staff is great, the cheesesteaks are the gold standard of cheesesteaks I've found! You won't be sorry! Salads are good too!

Wow.  I've had cheesesteaks all over the country. I've had the originals (Genos, Jims, Pats). I've had every cheesesteak location in Washington state, and up and down the east coast (I travel for work). Upon hitting this location today (appropriately named, paying homage to the philly originals) this place not only pays homage in name, but in style, quality, and taste. EVERY single base is covered. From the type of bread, the way it's done. It was absolutely mouth watering and the closest I have tasted to the originals. I found it pleasant that they offered hearty salads and sandwiches and tomato bisque soup for those cold days. But what do you REALLY come here for? That's right, the cheesesteaks.  My only quip, is bring in tastykakes for the dessert and you've got philly covered.

After shopping IKEA we found this nearby hotspot. Come ready for cheesesteak because the menu is very simple. Choose your size, meat, toppings and if you want fries. That's about it. Simple and sweet. The place is clean and the service is enthusiastic. Also, the portions ensure a good value.

Really amazing Cheesesteaks!  A choice of all the 'correct' cheeses (depending on which side of Philly you come from)...option to add jalapenos made my husband thrilled (he spent too many years eating cheesesteaks in Texas).  Good chewy bread that doesn't overwhelm the meat.  And we LOVE the lighter portion option...great price for a very reasonable amount of food.  Will absolutely be back!

Simple menu. Delicious food. Reasonably priced. Did take out for lunch today and went with the classic Philly steak sandwich with the wiz, onions, peppers, and mushrooms. Super tasty. Seasoned well. Just the right amount. Really hit the spot.  Didn't really care for the fries? Tasted like they had been fried in old oil.   Will be back for sure to try the chicken.   I need a nap now.

First visit and I was not disappointed. Easy menu and loved that they had sweet potato fries. If you go, I highly recommend the Fry sauce. It went well with regular fries and the sweet potato fries. Doing my best to try new restaurants and Forefathers did not disappoint. Our cashier even complimented my Harry Potter tattoo :) Very friendly! Thanks guys!

You won't be disappointed!!! Tony and Mary Crump have created a great restaurant  with an incredible staff. The food is delicious!  Have the original with fries. it's the best Cheesesteak in the valley!

Looking for good Philadelphia street eats? Well, Forefathers Cheesesteaks & Fries is the place for you!  While Forefathers' is light on Philadelphia decor like the Liberty Bell, the sandwiches would give fan favorite Philly restaurants like Pat's, Geno's or Jim's a run for their money. And you don't have to be a Cheese Whiz fan. The gooey provolone on my sandwich left my mouth watering. The sweet potato fries were equally good. Be sure to sample the available dipping sauces like ranch, honey mustard, or (my fave) fries sauce.  The next time you're in the mood for cholesterol count busting goodness, be sure to check this place out. Even Ben Franklin wouldn't need his bifocal specs to see that Forefathers is worth a fry...oops, I mean, try.

I went here and had very good large Cheesesteak with provolone and cheese whiz which was delicious. I also had Buffalo chicken strips and they were ok. Prices are around $9 -11 for sandwiches and other stuff varies. I recommend Cherry peppers with Cheesesteak sandwich. Friendly staff and quick. I highly recommend!

Hands down, the best cheese steak in the valley.  I pretty much order the same thing every time I go...the Regular Cheese steak with Wiz, OMG (onion, mushroom, green pepper) and sweet potato fries (and you get the drink for free when you order a side).  You HAVE to try their fry sauce...I could drink that stuff straight!  This is one of the few places that I get cravings for.
Best damn cheesesteaks this part of the east valley.

Ok I've been getting my cheesesteaks here for some time now . They really do have real authentic cheesesteaks here .. Meat is so yummy and the bread they use is awesome ! I would recommend this soot to anyone ! PS , try the fry sauce !!

This place is amazing! If you want to be lame and not try their sandwiches, I highly recommend their steak salad if you are a little more calorie conscious. The steak still taste amazing and they have this ranch dressing with jalapenos...mmmmm and don't forget about getting a cookie.

It was rather plan more healthy then greasy. I wanted my bread grilled and the told me it wasn't a good idea to do that. I dont understand why. But all in all it wasn't gourmet at all. Nothing fancy about the whole place. I would just come out and say lets go to fore fathers
Outstanding cheesesteaks.  Nothing but good experiences here.  While you may spend more than you planned for lunch, the portions are quite large.  Always a good choice.

I am no expert when it comes to Philly cheesesteaks so keep that in mind as you read this review. For me this has got to be the best I have had in Phoenix. Delicious cheesesteak and they have cheese whiz. My wife had a cheese whiz steak with mushrooms, onions, and hot peppers. Accompanied with a side of sweet potato fries. It was delicious. I ordered the same but substituted white American for the cheese whiz. It was wonderful. People there are super chill. Great place IMO. It's a must try!!

This place is legit! I don't know why I haven't reviewed this earlier seeing how its one of my favorite places!! Everything is fresh and tasty. I love the fry sauce, I end up putting it on everything. It's a little pricey for a walk up counter but the ingredients are quality. You get what you pay for. Side note, I came in here one time 15-20 minutes before closing and still got fresh hot food, and the staff was amazing. They didn't try to rush me out nor were they cleaning and shutting down. Props!!!
Cheesesteak, do it the right way, with cheese wiz, perfection. If you're a fan of sweet potato fries they have great ones.  Great lunch spot, order at the counter and sit, quick service.
Great cheesesteaks! Highly recommend, wish they would add condiments for you but that's the least of my worries here!

Wife never had a philly so we looked over the valley for reviews and saw this one came highly rated. Got here right when it opened up on a Sunday. It's been busy since we got here which was a good sign. Bathrooms very clean also fyi. Ordered a large philly sweet peppers, cheese wiz and fries and drink, $17. Damn. Hmm just saying. Meat is soft, could have a little more flavor but hey their recipe. Cheese wiz nice and cheesy and salty. Grilled onions and peppers of course were good.  Overall all was good until my wife pulls out some hair from her sandwich  part way through. Debated whether to say something now or on our way out as to not make a scene nor to try and get free food which we don't want. Braved the rest of our sandwiches cautiously and yes they were fine, but sorry hair in the food kinda gave her a bad experience. Have no problem coming back and trying g a chicken philly next time. But folks need to watch the hair, hair nets or get some bald cooks.

I got the cheesesteak with onions, peppers, mushrooms and cheese whiz. It was just okay, not enough cheese and not enough seasoning. I also order the cheese fries which just had cheese whiz on them, I don't think I would pay the extra for the cheese but he fries and fry sauce were good. I liked the concept of the restaurant sourcing local but unfortunately wasn't the best cheesesteak around.

Utter deliciousness-every bite, every thing, every time.  I have been coming here for years and I am amazed at how good it is every time. Fresh home made rolls, high quality beef or chicken, quality cheeses make an amazing sandwich, and the fries, oh my goodness soooo good, especially the sweet Potato.  The fry sauce is a must but if you like ranch, ask  for some on the side, hause made and best on the planet.no joke-I would have it as my drink if I could afford the calories.  Employee turn over is low so they must take care of the staff,  and the owner is usually there, working just as hard as every one else.  Thanks for an amazing lunch.

This is our place to go for cheesesteaks. We get the large chicken with grilled onions and peppers, fry, drink, and add an extra drink. It's a lot of food and doesn't kill the wallet. We get the sandwich with fry sauce on it. Soo tasty. Always clean when we go in and the staff is friendly. My only complaint would be they need more locations!

Forefathers is a pretty solid Cheesesteak Joint.  Everything is done fairly well; but, the thing I like best is adding Jalapeno Blue Cheese sauce to the Sandwich.  It just plain works and the spice is just right!  They also have fry sauce, which my sweets loves.  If your in the mood for a Cheesestea and your in the area, check them out.
Best Cheesesteak I have had. Their specialty Buffalo Chicken sandwich is even better. Try the awesome sweet potato fries. Super clean, super friendly.
Love this place. My favorite is the cheese whiz steak low carb style. I also like the cheese whiz fries. Can you tell I like cheese whiz...ha!

Nah, I don't think so. They had all the makings to look like a legit cheesestake place - big slab grill, whiz on the menu, pics of Philly...but then the mirage wears off and you drink the sand.  The meat reminded me of grocery store freezer chipped beef, lackluster flavor on a too soft roll.  The only thing I appreciated was the whiz-to-beef ratio.  Also did not appreciate the Disney World resort type prices - holy moly!  I think I'll keep looking.
Meat was flavorless, cheese was cheap, and sandwich was soggy. Did not enjoy. Fries were good tho.

I was hanging out with my neighbors and were talking about Mikes Cheese Steaks closing and bumming out that our to go place was no longer open. My friend Kevin mentioned Forefathers as a solid place to get a great cheese steak. I was doing some business in Tempe and remembered him mentioning this place so I decided to stop in.  This place is in a strip mall and has a modern look about it, not sure what the Cow pictures have to do about our forefathers though. The cheesesteaks were awesome and offered all the choices of cheeses and buns were soft. I will be back unless we get a better place here in the Gilbert area.

Love this place! Simple menu and great food. Locally owned and well run. Busy for lunch, full of folks that appreciate a great meal. Try the complimentary fry sauce in the cooler by the fountain drinks.
Original wit Wiz and mushrooms... there is none better I've tried.  Better be hungry to devour a whole large one too, pretty big.

A co-worker told me about it and I was intrigued by the name. I love supporting small businesses and especially adore the businesses make their love and support for America well-known. The food was delicious and well priced. The atmosphere was very clean and inviting. The staff was friendly and helpful which is always a major plus! I had the chicken cheesesteak which in past experiences from other restaurants have been very dry, but not here. It was very flavorful and moist.

Just went to this place for the second time. I love it. I'm not from Philadelphia, but I know this is probably the best cheese steak I've ever had. Local business. The owner took my order, and was cleaning up trays when his crew was super busy with lunch rush. This guy's doing it right. Huge fan. Great food.

This is the best cheesesteak in the East Valley! The sandwiches are handsdown the best! The staff is friendly, the tables are always clean and the fry sauce is addictive! I swear you can put that stuff on an old tire and it would be edible.

We stopped at Forefathers for lunch this Saturday . This was our first visit, but we thought we give it a south Philly try coming from the Penna area. so yes I do know what a cheese steak should be.  It was good!  Not great ! The place was busy and people were even sitting outside in the heat.   Even though it  was packed the staff was friendly and efficient. The line moved pretty quick.  Our Original Phillys were messy and good.   Our negatives:  The size of the dining area. It was a bit small and crowded today.  The meat was per-cook it take away from the moisture and meat had a little burnt taste. You should make the sandwiches to order ... every order with fresh rib-eye meat "not the pre cook" stuff. keep the grill a little lower not burn the meat.  I will try this place again the future to see if anything changes.  The price for two cheese steak, 2-fries, 2 coke was $ 22.00 and change a little steep.  The combo did not include the drinks.
The fry sauce is the only reason I go here! The famous Philly cheesesteak is an added bonus tho. Overall I'd recommend Forefathers to anyone who loves sandwiches!

Super delicious cheesesteaks.  The location is clean and tastefully decorated.  The bread was awesome.  Their fries are dynamite (malt vinegar and fry sauce are the way to my heart). We ordered a mini cheesesteak for our daughter and for free they upgraded her to a regular sized, great customer service.  We will definitely be back soon!

Loved the food and thought the chocolate chip cookies was one of the best I've had (little crunchy but mostly chewy).     Great atmosphere, very clean.  Also loved the military display in the back.  Feels homey
AMAZING!! Seriously the best cheesesteak I've ever had. And the employees are always super nice and happy.

Awesome Philly cheesesteak sandwiches. Wit whiz. The cheese fries are awesome. Peppers are fresh, not canned. You can see the meat and peppers being prepared in front of you. Very clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back!

Had a cheese steak with wiz and sweet/regular potatoes. The cheese steak was flavorful, not dry and very filling. I like that they have more condiments out (sweet peppers, banana peppers, jalapeños) so you can customize your sandwich as you wish. The fries were so so good!!! I'm not a huge sweet potato fries fan but these were not dry or mushy, just right with the perfect amount of salt.  Ohhh, and I had a cookie! Big and soft and yummy!

Literally my favorite place to eat at. And ironically, not for the cheesesteak, but for the buffalo chicken salad and fries!  I crave it and go 20 miles out of my way to go eat here! They are dog friendly and very friendly in general.  Wish there was one in central Phoenix so I could go more often!

its a great philly cheese steak and the fires are great too, but its all about that fry sauce! and if you feel like spending $12-15 bucks on a lunch, so i go like once a year if even cause its way to much for lunch but it is so good. i guess with honeywell people nextdoor that can afford high priced lunches they should survive a while.

Had someone pick up the food for me.   Had a steak with wiz and jalapeño and mushrooms and a side of fries The cheesesteak was pretty legit!  Spicy jalapeño and really good mixture of the meat and cheese The fries were deliciously salty.  I will  order here again for sure! Thank you!!
I've been searching for a good Philly cheesesteak.  This is probably the best one that I have found yet.  I would recommend this place. A little pricey.

Really great steak and fries. Little on the pricy side, but the food is awesome.  Got mine with wiz and fries. Big sandwich and full of flavor. Malt vinegar on the fries was a nice touch. The cilantro ranch was a great dipping sauce. Overall, a really great place and tasty sandwich.

Went there today for lunch...I was massively impressed with the overall cleanliness and friendliness of the place. I feel that sometimes you don't really find that here in the Valley.  I ordered a cheesesteak with onions and mushrooms. I also got a side of fries and my friend got a chicken cheesesteak...  I really wanted to like this place because of the positive reviews. I had such a wonderful experience there, but my cheesesteak was so bland -- almost like they forgot to put salt and pepper on it.  My friend's chicken cheesesteak was, according to her, "a huge salt lick". I think I'd rather have taken the salt lick over the non salty food I had. Even the mushrooms and onions lacked flavor...and the swiss cheese was bland as well.  I'm going to give this place another shot...but for now it's just ok. The fries made me happy enough to give them 3 stars.
Amazing sandwich! Cheese sauce on the philly is a must. A little pricy, but worth it. Please open one in tempe marketplace!

Philadelphia is pretty far to go for the "real thing," but I have been blown away twice at how close they come to replicating a great Philly Cheesteak! They do a fabulous job!  Oh sure, the roll isn't nearly as good as Delassandro's (my favorite in Philly') and it probably doesn't measure up to this year's winner (Johnny's Hots) in Philadelphia Magazine, but these people are doing a great job with what they have. They even offer one so large, I believe it comes with wheels, so you can drive it home.  Great taste and you can have Cheese Whiz on it to make it even more authentic. Plus look at ALL you will have saved in airfare!  If the rolls were better I would have opted for FIVE STARS, but these rolls will suffice to make it a terrific experience.

Being from Philly, I have made it a point to try every "authentic" Philly cheesesteak place I've come across since moving to AZ in 1982.  Since Longhitano's in Tempe closed close to a decade ago, every new place has fallen so short it's sad, really.  Not enough meat, rolls all wrong, meat TASTES wrong ...   Then my friend Brian, also a Philly native, came to town from L.A.  I decided we needed to try Forefathers.  We went ... we ate ... we ascended to a level of bliss not known in forever.  THESE are AUTHENTIC Philly cheesesteaks.  Don't have to pay for double meat, you can actually get a "wit wiz" ... AND a pizza cheesesteak.  OMG, sheer delight!  Brian had the cheese fries as well and they were so yum.  And the staff behind the counter were just AWESOME.  When we went to thank them for the amazing meal, they all cheered that they passed muster with us.  Honestly, anyone who did not grow up partaking of the wonders of real Philly cheesesteaks just cannot appreciate the awesomeness of Forefathers.  We liked it so much we are going back again on Sunday before Bri goes back to L.A.  He posted on his facebook page, and I quote "Who'd have thunk that Phoenix would have the most authentic cheesesteak I've had since leaving Philly?"  My ONLY beef (no pun intended) with Forefathers is that they have Hunts ketchup (which tastes awful IMHO) instead of Heinz.  Yes I know, some people consider ketchup on a cheesesteak sacreligious but that's how I grew up.  Sunday I'll try a pizza cheesesteak so it won't matter ;)  Oh, and try the homemade chocolate chip cookies ... oh sooooo good!

Great food, fair price. The cheesteak was great as were the fries. This isn't a place to go for a cheap meal, my combo of a large philly, fries, and drink was 16 dollars. I will return to try another delicious meal.

I checked Yelp and saw all the stars!!  I need to try this place and it was by Ikea.  Plus!!  I got the chicken & my hubby got the steak.  The place smells delicious.  I got the cheese fries.  They have a simple menu, I like it!    Ordered and I was expecting greatness.  I was so bummer to taste chicken and cheese.  No flavor (salt and/or black pepper)?  My hubby's steak was tasteless too.  The fries were good, but eat the cheese quick.  When it get cold, it does not taste good.

Took my son here while in the area for a baseball tournament last weekend.  I've never been to Philly so don't know what the cheesesteaks there are like but loved this place!  We definitely would plan on going back.
Drove all the way from Maricopa to get one. So good, steak is tender and they pack it on. The fries are also amazing. Luv this place.
This place is awesome.  Very very good.  Cheese steak was just like Jim's on south street.  From what I remember. But nonetheless it was awesome. Highly recommend.

All I can say is this... Fry sauce....on a cheese steak. Does not get any better than that!  I was sold as soon as I saw those magic words in the reviews.  Went there for lunch on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon, line was short and service was quick!  The place was clean and smelled just amazing.  It's hard to find a good cheese steak restaurant around here and I am so thankful to have found them!  I ordered a regular steak with cheese wiz and fry sauce.  I didn't know I needed fry sauce on a cheese steak until now. Their french fries were tasty and salted just right!  Everything was cooked perfectly.  I highly recommend this place. Kudos!

Just ate this and I'm already craving another...They really do have the "Best Steaks in Town" but also the best french fries! I'm not kidding. Best fries I have ever had. I was going to just snag a couple of my mom's, but after trying one I went and ordered a whole tray of them for myself. There's also a  whole refrigerator stocked full of complimentary specialty peppers and famous fry sauce. Most definitely coming back!!!

OOOMMMGGG...I am obsessed with Forefathers.  I think I could literally eat there every day.  They do have a bunch of sandwich options, although I've stuck with the Original "with wiz".  They have a small fridge with peppers and fry sauce--must try the fry sauce.  The staff there is so nice and it's always clean.  The only bad thing about going during lunch is that it is on the small side so seating can sometimes be a problem.  They do have outdoor seating though.

I must say I'm extremely impressed! I called 1 min before they closed and the young man that answered was still more then happy to take my order. The customer service here is a rare thing these days. I would come back just because of it! The environment was clean and the food was fresh despite me ordering 1 min before closing! I got some fry sauce to try cause the reviews rave about it, it's a must try that's for sure! I had an awesome experience! Can't wait to come back!
The Best Cheesesteak there is.  We've been to Philly and tried Pat's, Geno's, Steve's Prince of Steaks and Cheesesteaks at the Reading Terminal Market.  Forefather's beats them all.
This place is freaking delicious. I don't typically like cheesesteaks, because at most places, it's like a pile of greasy plastic and leather.

This place is all around delicious! I've had this spot bookmarked for a while and we finally checked it out. The cheesesteaks are great and the fries were surprisingly amazing!! I got my steak with sweet peppers, onions, mushrooms and the jalapeño ranch sauce is legit! We left satisfied and will definitely be back again!

If you're looking for the best cheesesteaks in the Valley, look no further! The meat they use doesn't have any fat, and is super flavorful! The service is fast, and fries are fresh and crispy every time! It feels a little cramped in space when the building is full, but I love that they have outdoor seating. I see everyone raving about their fry sauce, but I personally think the cilantro ranch is to DIE for!!! Quality 5/5 Service 5/5 Happy Tummy 1/1

Not busy at all today. Able to get in and out. Great service with some good recommendations!   This spot was recommended by a friend for lunch who said they had the best cheesesteak sandwitches in town. I have to say that I was I'm pressed and even more impressed with the sweet potato fries. The great thing I liked about customizing the sandwitches was that I was able to add bacon to the delightful treat!! You can never go wrong when bacon is involved!! Great option for lunch!

I think this place is great. I love the cheesteaks and their sweet potato fries. I tried their homemade chili once and it was good, but I found it to be a bit soupy.  The staff is always friendly and the dining area is nice and clean.

Fantastic #lowcarb / #keto option with their salads. Their steak salad is basically a cheesesteak with your choice of cheese and grilled shrooms / peppers / onions on a beautiful mix of fresh kale / mixed greens and romaine, broccoli, purple cabbage and cherry tomatoes. Get the jalapeño cilantro ranch and some free sides of pickled jalapeños / cherry peppers to kick it up a notch.  Very good and very fresh.

I am not happy with the co worker who introduced me to Forefathers.  Do I really need another way to feed my addiction to cheesy, beefy goodness?    Of course I do!  This small restaurant in a Tempe strip mall has earned a special place in my heart.  No, not just because of the artery-strengthening cheese.  It is home to the best cheesesteak I have experienced since moving to AZ.  While the menu offers a variety of choices other than cheesesteak sandwiches (chicken and even *gasp!* salads), I stick with what I know and love:  Regular with Cheez Wiz ($7.35) - bring your appetite, because this sandwich is big!  A generous portion of thinly sliced meat and that oh so important Cheez Wiz is nestled within a soft bun.  It is gooey, drippy and messy.  Perfect.  If Wiz is not for you, it is also offered with white American cheese, Provolone or Mozzarella.  While I prefer mine with just the basic meat and cheese, you healthy types can also get any combination of 'OMG' - onions, mushrooms and green peppers.  Fries are a very nice compliment to the sandwich.  Let's be honest here, fries are a very nice compliment to nearly anything.  Forefathers' fries ($2.55) are hot, salty and crisp.  If you haven't gotten your fill of Wiz on your sandwich, you can turn those fries into Cheese Fries ($2.95).  Either way, be sure to grab a container of 'fry sauce' (I am guessing this is some blend of ketchup and mayo).  One taste and you will want to put this on everything.    Lucky for me and my cholesterol level, this gem is nowhere near where I live.
Freaking love their cheesesteaks... Yum yum yum. Prices are a bit high, but worth it especially when you're in the mood!!

Good food, fast, friendly service. Cute little place with seating indoors and on a little patio out front. Clean too :-)  Likely will go back and try other options. I had the chicken with buffalo sauce, white cheddar and all the veggies. Was really good and the price was good too.
I went here for the first time yesterday 10/13/2016 during the peak lunch hour. The service was fast and the food was delicious.
Pretty good cheesesteak. We go there often.  Make sure to get an order of sweet potato fries!
These guys know how to deliver, best and only place to get a real cheesesteak! Roll holds the gooey wiz and tender beef
Found this place on Yelp. Really great cheesesteaks and fries. Get lots of fry sauce if you go there. So glad I stopped by!

Simple menu, amazing results! Their philly cheese steak was amazing with their sauce. It went well with the sweet potato fries. I had the chicken sandwich with the cheese wiz another time and I absolutely loved it. I need to go back!

I like big portions and I left satisfied with a regular cheesesteak. They had to option to include fry sauce on the cheesesteak, which of course I requested. Overall, very delicious. The fries were pretty good, albeti standard fare. The only real negative I have to say is that it's a bit too pricey to go here often. It was almost 30 dollars for a meal for two, but hey it's a giant heap of steak so I can understand the price point.
Stopped in here after a day of shopping. So yummy. Loved the cheesesteak and fry sauce. Must get the cookie, it was amazing!!!  To bad we don't have one in Vegas. This would be one of our regulars.

I had to come back. This is the second time I'm eating here in a week. Best cheesesteaks I've ever had! The white American is delicious and even the "cheese wiz", which freaked me out at first, is awesome. The fries have right about of crisp to them and come out hot. Definitely recommend this place.

My husband is from Philadelphia and this is the only place that he'll eat a Philly Cheesesteak. Amazing fries, fresh bread, and the closest thing to back home that he's found. Plus, their salads are amazing. The service is consistent and perfect every time.

Only place to go for an authentic cheesesteak in AZ. The meat is always grilled to perfection and anyone who knows anything knows the cheese whiz is where it's at when it comes to the philly chee. Then there's the fry sauce and unlimited hot and sweet peppers selection. My only question is, why haven't they expanded to the rest of the Valley?

The food is ALWAYS DELICIOUS!! The service is top notch, VERY friendly and you never wait an excessive amount of time for your order, no matter how slammed they are! This clearly demonstrates that the owner truly values his customers and strives for excellence and repeat business, ALWAYS impressed!! But today i was VERY impressed at the patience and professionalism the staff (might I add very young staff) demonstrated!! There was a large group (20+) of adults and young children. While the parents socialized and allowed their children to treat the entire establishment like a McPlayPlace (jumping and running along the benches, rolling a skate board on the floor, yelling, screaming, etc.) the staff remained incredibly professional and did not let any frustrations hinder the world class service and cleanliness!! They dodged children to make sure their soda machine was spotless, the condiment fridge was full, their paper towel rolls were loaded! I was SO impressed! I was frustrated with the lack of parenting and blatant disrespect for property and other people that was displayed, but,  the staff blew me away with their good attitudes! This truly speaks volumes of these individuals!!!
Soooooooooo good.   Do the cheez whiz!  Omg authentic.  We travel an hour for this stuff!!!

This place got such good reviews from people purportedly from Philly that I was excited to check it out.  If you are really from Philly, you will find this place disappointing.  The meat is pre-cooked. The rolls bear no resemblence whatsoever to an Amoroso roll. The fries are battered. When I requested cheese fries (with melted mozzarella--something you can get in any pizza parlor in Philly) they were happy to make it for me (as pizza fries are on the menu) but it was battered fries with a SLICE of mozzarella melted on top. The cheese was lucky that it coated 10 fries. There are better places in Phoenix to get a passable cheesesteak (there is one place who's name I cannot recall, that actually flies in Amoroso rolls, tastykakes and Goldenburgs Peanut Chews--that sort of effort is to be commended.)  If you are looking for a good cheesesteak you will do better at any Jersey Mike's.

Is it true that I haven't reviewed Forefathers yet? I am in serious disbelief. Forefathers is like my favorite thing ever ever ever. For starters, the service is so wonderful here. It is family owned, so it definitely has a warm, inviting feel to it. You can watch them cook your sandwich right by the register, and it seems they are always talking with each other, laughing, and having a great time. From pure speculation, I feel like the family that owns it really enjoy each others' company. But I digress.  Their cheesesteak sandwiches are amazing. Melt in your mouth, packed with flavor, fresh and hot off the grill amazing. The words escape me for how unbelievably delicious their sandwiches are. They are messy in the best kind of way - I don't even care how silly I look with greasy flavor dripping off of my elbow. Ten stars for the sandwiches. Fifteen stars for the sandwiches. A million stars for the sandwiches!  The decor is also really great here. Lots of patriotism up in that joint. But seriously, try these guys out. I promise you it will be one of the best sandwiches you'll ever eat.

My recommendation: pizza cheesesteak with mozzarella. Oh man, too delicious. (it's pizza sauce added to a traditional cheesesteak sandwich). The staff there are always super friendly and will chat about their cheesesteaks as long as you let them :)   It's a small place- maybe 15-18 tables- where you order at the counter and they call your number when the order is ready.

Can I give this place 10 stars, somehow?  My GOODNESS.  This place was worth waiting for and AMAZING doesn't even properly sum up the deliciousness served up at Forefathers.    The ambiance is cute and very patriotic...very welcoming.  The young, male dominated staff was also very nice and seemed happy to answer any questions.    The restaurant was clean as were the restrooms and everything was well stocked.  They have a nice outdoor patio area where you can eat as well and they provide a red condiment cart for things you may need if eating outdoors...very nice touch!   My husband and I are BIG eaters, no doubt about it, and we were shocked at the huge portions and even more shocked that neither one of us could finish our food. That is a RARITY!   We each order a large cheesesteak combo and our total came to $35.98 with two soft drinks included.  Check out the photos for more detail about the food.    Forefathers is an absolute GEM.  We aim to come back every time we visit the Tempe area. If you are lucky enough to LIVE here, check them out of you like cheesesteak sandwiches.  You will NOT be disappointed!

I have visited this place 2 times with my husband.  I'll be honest, I've never had a "cheesesteak" before, so my review is based off of Forefathers and not a comparison of a philly cheesesteak.  By the way, they don't claim to be a Philly Cheesesteak, just a Cheesesteak.  Maybe it doesn't matter.  Whatever.  The first time I had a regular size with Cheez Whiz, no peppers and onions.  In my experience you get big long strips of peppers and onions, so I passed.  I also heard a real cheesesteak has cheez whiz on it, not provolone, so I opted for the Cheez Whiz.  I also got an order of fries.  Let me say, you get a TON of fries and the regular size Cheesesteak is almost as big as a footlong.  This sandwich was YUMMY!!!  The fries were really good, and you have unlimited fry sauce.  I think the fry sauce was good, but a tad bit bland.  So i used ketchup as well.  My hubby got the regualar size Cheesesteak with provolone, peppers and mushrooms.  I saw that the peppers were small and diced up!  He love his meal.  The second time I got the regular sandwich, cheez whiz and peppers, he got the large sandwich with provolone, peppers and mushrooms.  We split and order of fries this time.  His sandwich was too big, and usually he can really pack food in, so this goes to show how big the sandwich is.  Again, we loved it!  ****Warning****** the food is a bit on the satly side, so order a large drink and bring some Diurex with  you!  Your calves will look like tree trunks if you don't!  We will eat here again for sure.  I wish they were open a bit later though, they close at 8pm.  :-(

This place is just OK for me.  I live nearby, so I'll have it every once in a while (~4-5 mos) when I'm tired of all the standard fast food / quick dine fare.  However, I always have higher hopes for this place, especially with the words "gourmet cheesesteaks" in their name.  Alas, I'm always somewhat disappointed.  While the food is always edible, it just never seems to live up to their name, or these other high star reviews.  The bread is always a bit soggy so there's that.  I'm also apparently an odd bird, as I enjoy lettuce and tomato on my cheesesteaks.  Lettuce nearly non-existent and tomatoes are sparse, but to be fair, this is typical of any cheesesteak joint when I order those toppings.  A better cheesesteak, IMO, is Corleone's at 16th St / Camelback (not sure if they have other locations), but I no longer live in that area.  So, to conclude, Forefathers is just OK, nothing special, but could possibly satisfy your cheesesteak craving, depending on how particular you are.  If you enjoy sloppy, messy, wet cheesesteaks (and I know some people do!) then this is your place.
Goood cheesesteaks! I went and picked up and it was delicious!! Best I've had so far. Picking up allowed the juices to marinate with the bread and was still hot when I got home.

Came here for a quick lunch. Amazing as always.  I probably should consider healthier options but it's just amazing. The meat is fresh, the bread is fresh, ordering is simple and straightforward. They have an excellent choice of toppings. I also think the fries may even be hand-cut and prepared on site. Keyword: maybe, as I never asked. Regardless, compared to the Philly cheesesteak sandwich in well... Philadelphia (I'm thinking of Geno's, Pat's, Luke's, etc) Forefathers makes the best I've had in Arizona. Keep up the great work!

Love this place!  My buddy and I found this place one night when driving around looking for places to eat.  I'm not really in to cheesesteaks, but this place is full of awesome.  I've never tried it, but you can also get an authentic (so I'm told) cheesesteak with "wiz" on it - no, no one is peeing on it...it's Cheese Wiz... LOL  The place gets a little loud because it's all tile flooring, but the cheesesteaks are better than any other cheesesteak place I've been to in the valley.

Excellent flavor with wiz and came hot like lava. Being picky I like my roll a little crusty. These were soft. Great ambience and clean. Condiments we're on point. Highlight was the fries!!! If comparing probably not getting a return from me but enjoyed the visit. Price was a little high.

Forefathers is great! I went there yesterday and was greeted at the register by the owner who chatted me up for a few minutes and suggested fry dipping combos for me to try, I can't say enough about the staff, great people.    Yesterday I had the original and a side of sweet potato fries. The original is a 9 inch (I think) roll with sliced rib-eye, grilled onions, and cheese whiz... holy cow, it was delicious. The meat was tender, not stringy or chewy and had enough flavor to make it through both the cheese and the onions, which were just wonderful icing on the cake. The roll was firm enough to hold up to all the juices, yet was soft and tasted very fresh. The sweet potato fries also blew me away, they were not overly fried by any means, just enough to be hot and steaming and were wonderfully sweet. The owner convinced me to take a side of honey mustard to dip them in, and it was a terrific choice. The dressing added a little sweetness, but the mustard added just enough tang to produce a delightful symphony between the two. Yum.    I strongly recommend Forefathers, I have been several times and it is so good each time. The decorations are interesting, the food is delicious and the staff is attentive and extremely friendly and helpful. Go. You'll thank me.

A couple weeks ago a friend had told me I'd never had a real cheese steak unless I'd had one with Cheese Whiz. Turns out the Cheese Whiz used on cheese steaks isn't the same kind college students stack with Ritz crackers to give themselves early heart attacks.   I had the #1 (Steak and Cheese Whiz) and it was delicious. I got fries and a drink as well and my total came out to ~$10. The portions are quite large and they give you a hefty serving of meat in the sandwich.   Be careful when eating because these sandwiches are literally dripping with cheese. The bun was great and somehow didn't get soggy.   I've been to a few places serving cheese steaks in the valley and this is the best, added bonus is you can be in and out of here in five minutes.

I have had both Pat's and Geno's in Philadelphia , theses are WAY better than both.  The hoogie buns are soft and fantastic. The meat has just enough fat to make it melt cheese wiz goodness everywhere!!  In heaven!  In heaven!

Amazing. Best cheese steaks in AZ and the fries are amazing. Order comes out quick hardly have to wait make sure to ADD cheese and their sauces are awaome. Just a great friendly and clean environment..... Must try

I have never been to Philadelphia and I have never tried a cheesesteak there but I have been to fore fathers and can tell you that this place is amazing.   I always get the regular cheesesteak with wiz and onions plus some fries, you will love them both. The only thing I wish they still did was make their amazing cookies, even if it was just a once a month thing.

Forefathers is definitely our new regular treat. From "one nation under God" at the door, to the "Ultimate Sacrifice" wall, everything about this neighborhood spot represents the awesomeness of America. The awesomeness of opportunity, capital and making a kick ass cheesesteak thats better than any other west of the Mississippi River.

Ordered a regular but the guy ordered me the large one, that didn't set well with me first off. Then ordered with cheese barely knew it had cheese on it. Asked for vegetables on it - I like onions Ann bell peppers and mushrooms work. Just have had better!

I'd like to begin by saying that I am not a cheesesteak lover or aficionado..but I find myself thinking about these cheesesteaks everyday. It is by far the best cheesesteak in Arizona (according to my boyfriend who has tried them all) and is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. I wish I didn't live in North Phoenix because I would eat here everyday if I could. You have to try it and you won't regret it!

The staff is really friendly and today I got a free drink with my order. I went to have lunch with a coworker and really wasn't that hungry. I only ordered fries (which are delicious) and the guy was nice enough to give me a drink. Some places will charge you for a glass of water! My coworker raved about his cheesesteak and I have always been a fan of their Buffalo chicken. The portions are large, so they really fill you up. They have a pretty good fry sauce too! This place is really close to where I work so that's a huge plus. Highly recommend this place if you're in the area. Don't leave without trying their cookies!! They're to die for!

First time here. Great service and great food.  The cheesesteaks are really good. I had one with cheese wiz and my wife with american cheese. Ordered a side of fries and got a free large drink! They have fresh peppers in a mini fridge by the drinks fo free! The wife and I will definitely be back.

This cheesesteak is part of my ton three that I've tried. I always want to go back for seconds but I get too full from the loaded sandwiches. The cheese wiz/steak ratio is deliciously melted when you get it, just perfect. They have their own sauce on the side along with a variety of peppers you can add in. I have yet to try them since I stick to the original one. It's a must try!

Yelp brought me here. Your reviews were spot on! Such a cool little atmosphere and a cheesesteak you can't find elsewhere in the Valley. Definitely take advantage of the "Fry Sauce!" Even good on the sandwich! Will definitely recommend to friends.

Very good cheesesteaks! They cool it fresh right in front of you and it's ready to eat very quickly. They have a simple menu and that tells me their very confident in the food they serve, and rightfully so!! Strongly recommend eating here when in the area!
Fantastic place, best cheese steaks in town. Always clean and the employees are super nice!!

I must admit when they first opened I was not impressed with this place at all... But I always give a second chance to a restaurant and I am glad I did. I always order a #1 Philly Original - (Served with grilled onions and cheese whiz "wiz" and an order of sweet potato fries. The cheese steak is good but I have to say the best part would be the sweet potato fries. Make sure to get all the extra condiment from the little refrigerator on the way out the fry sauce is a must for dipping.

Delicious and fast, which I appreciate very much when we are on a time crunch! We both got the cheesesteaks one with cheese wiz and the other with provolone and of course with all the fixings! It's a lot of food so I suggest the mini sub for sure if your not a big eater! Don't waste anytime go try this place now!
Clean enjoyable restaurant with speedy service.  My cheesesteak was delicious!  I will definitely be back.

This place's portions are great for cheese steaks , and so far in Phx for the dollar amount probably the best dollar pre steak ratio. The meat is cooked well , the bread is not over fully and they have the wiz option which if you are from back east is a must. The staff seem quite friendly and the place is clean and spacious . I should of taken a picture because once again , they do not slack on the meat. This would be my favorite spot but Frank's down in Tucson just has number one az cheese steak hands down . I spent about 16 bucks for cheese steak (they include mushroom bonus points) and cheesy fries (not a ton fries but come on the steaks are big enough meal). They threw in free drink so bonus points again.   I would recommend stopping by the staff may be a bunch of kids but the steaks are all grown.

Ahhh almost forgot bout this place. We went there for lunch from work when it first opened up. My friend could not shut it about Philly steak and CheezeWiz (Or whatever its called.)  So, they dragged me in there. I could not bring myself to order fat dripping and CheezeWiz smothered real Cheese Steak so i ordered chicken one instead. It was BORING, dry and uninteresting. My granny (One from mom's side who can not cook) could make it way better.  So, while i honestly can not evaluate their main product - Cheese Steak,  whatever i got kinda suxed!  They do draw big crowds now and sometime there is no place to seat, or at least that is what guys from work telling me. But whataver...  "I no like"

This was hands down the best cheesesteak place I've been to. We walked in as first timers and were greeted by Laurie. We told her we have never been in before and she gave us a whole run down of the menu and what she recommended - all with a very welcoming attitude.  Upon receiving our order, we noticed her as well as the other young gentlemen make sure the place was clean, and they even stopped two times to ask how we liked our meal.  Which was delicious may I add.  Highly recommend coming here for quick, friendly and delicious bite to eat.

I've been here about three times now. I'd have to say they consistently serve the best Philly cheesesteak, fries and fry sauce I've ever had. The foods hot and fresh. Oh and if you're a cookie lover make sure to grab your favorite one before you leave for dessert.   The prices aren't to high I'd say about average for the amount of food you get. The wait especially during the lunch and dinner hour is a little long but definitely worth it. For the amount of people that come here to eat during peak hours you'd think they'd had enough space to sit and enjoy your meal but that's not the case here. If you have time to wait for a seat then really it's no biggie but if it is call ahead to pick your food up and head out.   The employees are very friendly and considering how crazy busy this place gets its pretty clean.  Overall, definitely a must try
YUM, YUM, YUM!!!! If you have never been here you should definitely try it out! Quick service and great salads and cheesesteaks!

Got the large steak sandwich with provolone, onions, mushrooms, sweet peppers and fry sauce, and a side of sweet potato fries. Came with a free drink. The fries were a little bit expensive but the large sandwich is way more than enough food and we'll worth $12. The bread was soft and spongey, i loved it. The fry sauce was undetectable on the sandwich but I didn't mind seeing as they have a fridge full of free fry sauce next to the drinks. I'm interested in trying the chicken with buffalo and spicy blue cheese. Also the steak with wiz. I have a feeling that this will be all I'm eating for about a week.

The other day I stopped at the Family Friday food truck event in Peoria on m way home from work, and OMG I'm so glad I did.,everything looked yummy, but what made forefathers stick out more was the smiling man working the counter, and the smell oh my goodness the smell of the cheesecakes was amazing. I love a good smile and someone willing to help. After talking a few minutes I chose my cheesesteak. Let me tell you although it looked basic it was the best tasting cheesesteak I've ever had. The bun was slightly toasted and didn't get soggy which is a big deal to me. The onions didn't over power it either . Perfect. My only wish is that they'd make a permanent location in the west valley so we could enjoy these more often.

First, I'd like to say the rating is based on the food. Before I get into that, let me address the noise level. This is probably one of the noisiest restaurants I've been in. There were less than 20 people at any given time while I was there and the noise level was absolutely awful. I could barely hear the guy taking our order, and I have (what my husband refers to as) dog-like hearing.  (there is an outside seating area) The cheese steak subs are uber good!!! Get the Whiz on yours, because that makes it authentic AND it tastes better (we've now been two times and the hubs tried provolone this time and 'meh). We've tried both the steak and cheese options, both are terrific. Their fries are pretty good, too!

Napkins required! I dare you to eat a wonderfully gooey cheesesteak here without making a mess.   They do a great job on their food. The roll is springy and fresh. The steak has great flavor, texture, and a thickness. You have a lot of cheese options, but they have the classic cheese wiz. We're talking old school style cheese wiz. A real treat, but if you're a bit faint of heart on cheese wiz, their other options won't disappoint. Grilled onions are good and retain a nice texture. A HUGE plus in my book is being able to add regular ol' sautéed bell peppers, instead of the sweet pickeled ones (they have those too, I just can't get past the taste of them no matter where I am). For a little heat, you can add cherry peppers or jalapeños. I went for cherry peppers and it was awesome. The even better part that has to be mentioned is this is a cheesy cheesesteak. I like mine cheesy and without fail I have to order extra cheese, well until I came here. Their regular sandwhich, without extras, satisfies my cheesy needs and then some. Of course, should I ever want to experience cheese nirvana, they offer an option for extra cheese. One of these days, I'll order extra cheese, simply because I can, but right now the idea of extra cheese here is slightly intimidating in the best possible way.   Fries are fries, but their's are good. What makes them special is the dipping sauce they have. Reminds me of what mom called "russian dressing" and put on hamburgers when I was a kid. I still make it to this day.  I'm not going to ruin the recipe for them, but it's a mayo and tomato based sauce that you mustn't pass up. It's almost a mexi-ranch without the ranch flavor.   Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable enough to make solid recommendations, if you want to have a sandwhich that is far better than an average cheesesteak. Service is quick, but there was nobody ahead of me when I went. Prior trips have felt similarly fast though with consistently good quality service.   In a valley of mediocre cheesesteak shops, Forefathers is a cut above the rest.
I was born and raised in South Philly and this is the best Cheesesteak I have found so far in the 13 Years i have been here in AZ.
Hungry feed your belly with some wiz on your cheese steak always good..  Try it once youll tell your friends its so good.
Philly with cheese wiz onions and bell peppers! BOMB.COM... Nothing more to say! I will gladly gain 30 pounds in a month eating this daily

Lots of people make long reviews for some fast food joint,  im going to make mine short. My friend wanted to go here, so I thought I'd give it a try since I love cheeses teams. I've had the real thing in Philly, but you could never hold a candle to the best. Honestly, I don't know what the hype is all about. It's not that great to me. They use Kraft cheese whiz, which I could have bought at the grocery store. Meat didn't have much flavor. I felt like I got railed on the price, $30 for two sandwich combos, Cmon. Easy to miss unless you know where it is. Forgettable experience and was more upset when I left then what I came in due to the high expectations of other yelp reviews.

3-3.5 stars... Needed to grab lunch and looked to Yelp to direct me while traveling.  Reviews looked good for Forefathers so we tried it out.  When we arrived the place was packed...which was a good sign.  Service was fast and friendly with everything cooked to order in front of you.    Overall the Philly was good (steak, w/ provolone and hot sauce), as were the fries along with their 'fry sauce'.  It wasn't the best Philly I have ever had, but would be worth stopping in again for a quick lunch.

Stop by for a quick lunch .. I saw a lot of good reviews on this place so I decided to try . I got a regular with provolone, onions , peppers and jalapeños and added fry sauce . When I said excellent , EXCELLENT  . It's really hard to find food in Arizona that's actually really great . I will be returning soon.

Four days and maybe seven hours ago, our hunger brought us forth to eat cheesesteak, to try a new restaurant, conceived in Philly, but dedicated to the proposition that not all cheesesteaks are created equal.  We shared a large chicken cheesesteak with everything (onions, bell peppers), and cheese wiz, along with some sweet potato fries.  The chicken cheesesteak came with a good amount of tender chicken, with a lot of flavor.  There is a free-range mini fridge that is stocked with sweet , hot peppers, and fry sauce which is nice so you can customize your order with as many or as little peppers as you want.  While the ingredients were good quality, the cheesesteak as a whole naturally doesn't really compare to any I've had in Philly, but it's good for Arizona!  The sweet potato fries were my favorite part of the meal.  They were excellently cooked with just the right amount of crunch while still tender and sweet inside.  So would our forefathers be impressed by Forefathers?  They probably wouldn't know what a cheesesteak would be, but if they tasted one, I would say they would be!

Forefathers is great. It's the best cheesesteak I've had in Arizona so far. I haven't tried many but best so far. The small sized one should be filling enough for most people. The fries are very tasty. It was a reasonable price for such a high quality. The staff was friendly and quick making the food. The restaurant was clean
I was informed they've been in business at the same location 17 yrs now. You don't stay open that long unless it's delicious, which it is!

I've eaten here a few times now, and the cheesesteaks are absolutely amazing, but I don't care for their french fries and they blew it on the fry sauce (I am originally from the birthplace of fry sauce, so I know my fry sauce). The fries and sauce are what is keeping them from earning 4 or 5 stars from me.

Simply amazing. Every time we go here it's great and it never fails. The cheesesteak is great but so is the chicken sandwich with buffalo sauce, celery and ranch. I also recommend the buffalo chicken salad with the jalapeño cilantro ranch dressing! It is delicious and def has a kick to it! Wonderful customer service as well.

This place is amazing! Delicious cheesesteaks, by far the best in the valley. Juicy and delicious. From the moment you walk in you are greeted and it feels like home - even so far as to yell your name out once they know you. I love Forefathers and recommend it to any and all!
Best Cheesesteak in AZ.  Been to Forefathers a lot and it never lets me down.  The service is good and the food is great.

Wow!  Who could imagine an awesome,  genuinely prepared cheesesteak in tempe AZ.  Menu item #1, cheese 'wit'.  My kids and.wife loved it as well.  To top it all off,  one if the best bread puddings I ever had.

Ahh cheesesteaks, what a sensitive topic. Well I feel that before I start I have to state that I AM a Philly native. I'm not saying my review/opinion holds more weight than that of others, but basically, it does.   Forefather's is good to go in my book! I tried their "the original" and it did bring a slight smile to my face when I bit into it. The shredded style of steak isn't my choice (see my Steve's Prince of Steaks review) but other than that, they've got it down OK. I won't ding them on their not using a certain kind of roll made from Philly local bakery Amoroso's as I don't believe that is a possibility out here.   The only thing that I can say that is a negative about the place is that they are pretty pricey for the amount that you get. However, I too will accept this as things like this are pretty much a novelty here, and I guess I'll have to pay a little bit more for less to remind myself of home in between visits back east.  The fries were OK, and I didn't get to use any of their fry sauce so I can't comment on that.   +1 for the patriotic decor, and another +1 for their tribute to the "forefather's of cheesesteaks" display, even though I believe that the big two have become tourist traps and aren't really that great anymore (see SPoS review). Jim's is in the NE very close to Steve's. You "could" say that Jim's is Steve's biggest rival, except that Steve's is without peers.

Forefathers is AWESOME!  Not sure that much more needs to be said.  The food is great, but what really makes me smile about Forefathers is that we've always had a positive service experience and we've been here lots and lots of times!  The other positive is that the restaurant is always clean!  The tables are cleared and wiped down pretty much as soon as someone leaves.  The fountain drink station remains clean, the napkins are stocked, etc.  Consistency is what makes this a place worth frequenting!  So I will end where I started.  Forefathers is AWESOME!

I'm impressed by Forefathers because the cheesesteaks here are almost as good as the ones I make!  3.5 stars, rounded up because Ben Franklin is a rebel, indeed.  Here's my game plan when I come to this joint:  1. Large cheesesteak with OMG (onions, mushroom, green pepper) and provolone 2. Added pizza sauce and cheese whiz 3. Small order of french fries 4. Grabbed sweet peppers and cherry peppers from the fridge 5. Combined everything together 6. Thought to myself, "I am amazing."  All that for under $13.  Not bad!  The steak was juicy and tender, the veggies and cheese were of excellent quality, the pizza sauce took it up a notch, and the cheese whiz sealed the deal - like frosting on a cake!  I also really enjoy how they have the sweet peppers, cherry peppers, jalapenos, and fry sauce in little to-go containers.  When I'm not in a steaky mood, I opt for the chicken + mozzarella + buffalo sauce, can I get a "hell yessss"?  Bottom line: come out here and make the founding fathers proud that our country can celebrate unapologetic gluttony/awesomeness.

My partner and I (who are cheesesteak fanatics and have tried every place in tempe) have come to the unanimous decision that this is the best cheesesteak place in the tempe/phx area. And they have mini portions perfect for those with small appetites like me! We go at least once a week

Good steak sandwich, steak was thin and no fat. The only downside was the bread was a little soggy, would be perfect if the bun was toasted. The tomato Parmesan vinaigrette dressing for my salad was excellent, lettuce was fresh!

Omg so yummy! Best in Arizona! Fast friendly serves and amazing food. My husband eats out everyday for lunch and he found this jewel and shared it with me. Never in my life did you think I could get cheesesteak in Arizona that taste so great. I highly recommended this place to everyone.

Gotta say I'm not as impressed with forefathers anymore. The sandwiches seem smaller and not as flavour as they used to be. For two sandwiches and one drink it cost over $20!!! That's really overpriced. Insanely overpriced!  Additionally during their busiest time they allow patrons who are no longer eating to just hang out while a line starts to form for those waiting for a table to open. We didn't have time to wait so we were forced outside in the 110° heat. No misters, no outdoor fans. We were sweating horribly and both of us just scarfed down our food just so we could get back into our air conditioned car. We didn't enjoy it at all. Either get a larger establishment or ask people to not hog tables when they're clearly done and its the busiest part of the day. Awful experience.

Mmm I hate to say this, but I wasn't impressed.  I got here at noon on a Sunday and the place was empty.  The menu was easy to follow, the lady at the register was nice, I like that they have free peppers and fry sauce (reminded me of Cane's sauce) next to the soda machine but the sandwich wasn't impressive.  When served, it looked like there was a ton of meat, but as soon as I took a bite, I realized that half of it was bread and the sandwich, in fact, had no problem closing.  I felt like there wasnt enough cheese on mine, but my boyfriend complained he had too much, a matter of perspective I suppose.  Or inconsistency.  Prices were average for a philly cheesesteak ($8.30 for a regular).  I'm not from Philly so I can't weigh in on whether it's authentic but I doubt I'll be back.

My first time in here. I had a chicken sandwith with onions, mushrooms and fries. The flavor was acceptable,  I wished they cut the chicken cubes in smaller size bites. The fries left oily on the plate. The fries sauce was great.  I also had steak sandwich.  It was good. The bread was great touch. I might go back to give another try.

A colleague recommended this place to me so, I went there today for the first time.  I asked if I could just make up what I wanted and they were so friendly and patient till I figured out what would fit my meal plan. I just asked for chicken and provolone in a bowl. The food tastes as good as the pictures look. The fries looked amazing too, but i am staying away from the bad stuff for now so I didn't try them. Overall, the service was great, friendly, fast, (super fast) fresh food and I have already recommended to several people!

This place is really great, the food and the employees. I have come here a few times, I always get the Philly Original wit wiz and onion. I put some sweet peppers on it and sometimes sprinkle some malt vinegar over it. Th fries are yummy with the fry sauce. I like their iced tea and I like that they make a chilled espresso drink that you can pour yourself for the same price as a soda. The employees are really friendly, they say hi the minute you walk in, converse with you, and even offer advice. The guy behind the counter gave me and my kids free cookies, which were awesome by the way! This place seems pretty true to Pat's Steaks in Philadelphia with the chopped meat and cheese whiz, I am guessing it would taste similar.
YUMMY! Fabulous cheesesteaks! Huge size and totally worth the price! Sweet potato fries and regular fries were delicious also! Cool little place in a nice part of Tempe! Friendly staff!

If you were one of the many like me that used to make the pilgrimage to Bruchi's CheeseSteaks in Ahwatukee, you were probably also disappointed when you arrived that one day to find them out of business.  For years following their closure I sampled cheesesteaks here and there, but none of them even came close to the taste of what Bruchi's delivered.  Then a co-worker introduced me to Forefathers Gourmet Cheesesteaks & Fries in Tempe and I struck gold. These guys can really turn out a great sandwich.  My favorite is the #2 Cheesesteak (with grilled onions and white American cheese). The regular size is more than enough to satisfy most appetites, but if you are really hungry go for the large. The fresh baked Italian bread is great and they offer a variety of different flavor cheesesteaks to choose from.  If you do a combo meal with regular fries, be sure to get some "fry sauce" near the soda dispenser for something a little different.  I highly recommend this place to anyone out there who loves a good cheesesteak. Enjoy!
Gotta be some of the best cheesesteaks I've ever had. People are very friendly and fast! A must for steak lovers!
One of the best cheese steaks I have ever had I recommend this place crew was very nice place was clean and peppers was awesome
Delicious every time! Never been to Philly but I guess I never need to. Get it with whiz, that's the best way.

My wife and I just ate at your great restaurant in Tempe tonight! What attracted me was the name, "Forefathers," wondering if it had a patriotic flavor, and it did! The Cheesesteaks and fries were amazing, and I love the pictures of Washington, Jefferson, and Franklin on the wall, along with the American flag captioned with "In God We Trust" on the outside window. The staff was especially courteous, friendly, and professional too! We're new to AZ and will make Forefathers a regular stop.

This is the BEST Cheesesteak I have ever had! The meat was juicy and the mushrooms and onions were cooked perfectly too! The fry sauce was out of this world. We also tried the tomato bisque which was extremely tasty! I only wish we had one back home in California.
Best cheesesteak I've had in town so far.  This is about the 6th place I've been.  I'll drive the 30 miles round trip just to get their sandwich.
I have been looking for a good cheesesteak place in Tempe and I think I've finally found it. A bit expensive but the cheesesteak and fries were very delicious and you have to try their fry sauce!!
This place is legit! I got the OMG Chicken Cheesesteak, and it hit the spot. Clean restaurant with friendly staff. We will be back.
Yummy!  A high quality sandwich on DELICIOUS bread.  Unlimited sides of sweet & hot peppers.

The customer service is probably the best I have ever experienced. Actual genuinely friendly people that are HELPFUL from when you walk in till you walk out.  Food is real good too. (I ignore the fact that some people put wiz on a cheesesteak.) Nice clean place. ...and the cookies. Get a cookie. They are a treat.  They had highchairs for my little one. Even though he deceided he wanted to sit on top of the table.   You will see me there again.  *Update*** downgrade from 5 Stars to 3 Stars   We went there a while back and they changed their sweet potato fries!!! I got some to go and started to snack on them in the car. I immediately noticed they were different than the ones I love, so called them. I asked if they changed their fries and he said yes. I asked if it was permanent or they just ran out or something. He said these are the fries from now on.  Until they go back to the old ones I probably wont go there nearly as often. The fries are that big of a deal. :(  2nd Update*** upgrade from 3 to 4 I has been a while and the sweet potato fries are pretty tasty now. And the service is still as good as ever.
Excellent, excellent, excellent when it comes to cheesteaks. After my first bite I knew they had earned a customer for life. Friendly, fast service. I will be a regular.
Best Philly cheesesteaks I've had in Phoenix!! Good quality and tastes great!! Be sure to try the sauces...Jalapeño ranch and fry sauce yum! Nice people too :)
Yummy! I love the Buffalo Chicken Cheesesteak and the sweet potato fries. Really great food and decent prices, especially for the quantity of the food.

WOWZA! If your a fan of sweet potato fries then Christmas has come early..... simply put, the combination of Forefathers fry sauce and sweet potato fries is enough to make you loose your marbles.  Now as for the Cheesesteaks.... they are awesome.  I've had some good ones here and there but Forefathers takes the cake.  Overall I was very impressed.  Im not from the east coast so I cant make a real comparison, but come on if your in AZ then who cares about the east coast really (the food is so bland and boring usually).    Friendly staff, casual environment ..... you can't go wrong!
Awesome place! The food is good, the service is fast and the people are friendly! It's a bit packed in there, but who cares if you're squeezed in, when the rest is so awesome!

Very good food! Love the taste with the cheese wiz..Yeh, I'm easy to please having grown up on cheese wiz. Had the large cheesesteak work meat and cheese only. Tasted great to me...won't know till I go to Philly how close to the real deal it is. Had the cheese fries too! Satisfied customer! Only knock is the price for the large...I could of ate 2 of them effortlessly...but after getting cheese fries and a drink, almost $14 just for me. Great food though...now to my wife's leftovers!

It's Saturday night and I have not eaten much all day.  I had read some reviews about Philly cheesesteaks and was kind of craving one.  I checked around on Yelp and found Forefathers.  So off we went!   We pulled up and walked in, looked at the menu on the wall and ordered.  I had the standard cheessteak with peppers and onions and sweet potato fries.  My daughter had the "fox" off the children's menu.  It was chicken strips and fries with a drink.  The young man working the counter was polite and friendly.  We got our drinks and sat down.  There are about 12 tables inside and about 5 outside.  The place was was clean and tidy.  When my order was ready I went to pick it up and the young man asked if there was anything else I needed.  I said no, we were good but when I went back to the table they had forgotten the ranch for my daughter's chicken strips.  She is 7 and very independent so she went up to ger her ranch.  The young man was apologetic and asked and gave her two cups of ranch instead of one.  She was happy.  And she said her meal was yummy.  My cheesesteak was so good.  Great flavor, tendor meat and fresh roll.  And the cheese just oozed out.....yum! The sweet potato fries were great too.  Refillable drinks too.   While we were eating my daughter was looking at the pictures of Benjamin Franklin, George Washington, and Thomas Jefferson.  We had a nice little history lesson while we were eating.  She also liked the lighting.  She said it looked like a party.  There were lights draped from the ceiling along with the regular lighting and with the high ceilings it did have a sort of patio feeling.    Being a parent I have probably seen bathrooms in every place we have ever been to, the grocery store, gas station, and restaurants. The restroom here was fantastic.  When I opened the door it was not at all what I expected.  It had nice tile and the faucet had a fancy spikett that turned on automatically when you put your hands under it.  There was a nice smelling soap and lots of paper towels too.  And it smelled nice in there!!  Yes, it smelled nice!  Not like a bathroom at all and it was clean!!    I'm not from Philly but  I know what I like and this was a darn good cheesesteak!  Thank you Forefathers!!

I travel to Philly on business quite often, this is as good as any cheese steak I have had in Philly,  and is the best I have found in Phoenix.   Get the #1 "Wit Wiz" to be the most authentic.   Also, try the sweet potato fries..  On a side note, my friend wanted soup, and got the tomato basil bisque, and he said it was delicious (I had not even noticed they served soup).

Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  A very solid cheesesteak joint.  A little pricier than your average steak, but still very good and worth the price.  Standard steak, with onions and wiz.  That's my point of comparison.  The bread here is a liiiiitle too hard, but it's close.  It's chewy and it stands up to the cheese and meat juices.  The meat is well seasoned, tender, and they give you enough wiz.  I'm a sucker for their salad here, mostly because of their house dressing.  I don't know why I love it so much, but the salad alone almost warrants 4 stars for this place. Their fries are fine.  I am not a huge fan of their fry sauce, it's lacking a little something.  But, bonus points to them for putting a couple different types of hot peppers for your steak.  So did the whole Pat's, Geno's, Dalessandro's thing (which are in reverse order of my favorites, still have to try Tony Luke's), so I can't give this place 5 stars.  But it's very good, the place is clean and the staff is friendly and like I said, they don't skimp on the wiz.

Love this place. I was born and raised in the Philadelphia area. Since moving to Arizona every cheesesteak has left me disappointed. This is the best thing I've found! Build your own cheesesteak or chicken cheesesteak with lots of options and cheeses! People are extremely nice and wonderful at explaining their menu. I will definitely come here the next time I'm craving a cheesesteak!
Quick service and a freshly prepared, delicious chicken cheesesteak sandwich.  The self-serve pepper fridge is a nice touch.

Holy insanely delicious, Batman! You must try the cheese whiz....it's crazy good. If you get the fries, make sure to use their special fry sauce. Quick friendly service and delicious food....I will definitely be back!

A small place with nice decor and seating outside.  I had the steak philly with wiz OMG hold the g.  I am a fan and will be back.  The staff was nice. Friendly from the moment I walked in and even thank yous on the way out.   It was half full at 2pm.  I can imagine this place could get crazy busy.  My order was ready in minutes.  I too liked the to go containers of fry sauce and jalapeños.    I'm not the eco friendliest person, yet I wonder why 3 monitors are needed to display the menu when it could be on a printed board.  It's the trendy thing to do now with monitor menus, yet the prices and items are not changing that frequently.   Seems a waste of electricity.   Off that rant, a great place, great philly,  friendly staff.  My new favorite sandwich place.

Lots of friends & coworkers from the East Coast spoke highly of this place, so I decided to stop through after my post office run.  I spent a few minutes trying to fully understand the menu and how it was setup, as I was assuming it was like any other steak spot I've visited... Wrong!! I'm not a big fan of mushrooms, onions, & peppers on my sandwich so I figured to add lettuce & tomatoes... yeah, they don't have that as an option and that's what I was looking for to add to my sandwich.   Decided to go with American Cheese and just steak and asked what else I could add to my sandwich given that they didn't have tomatoes and lettuce. I ended up adding their personalize fry sauce to give it some 'flair'.   Lunch ran me $13 for a regular sandwich regular fries and a drink.  Food was ready quickly and I was very much surprised at the taste and quality of the meat along with the bread!!!
