Fries were good too and the nice thing is they have condiments like fry sauce, variety of peppers and other items that you can grab from the fridge at the condiment station.  My only downside was i couldn't add lettuce and tomatoes, but I do understand for my steak and cheese guru's that is not the right thing to add... still good experience!

My friend took me here and I cannot thank him enough for finally showing me this hidden beauty! Food was unreal, I especially loved all of the available variety+additions you could add to your cheesesteak. Plenty of different choices for me to keep coming back because it's just that good.  Staff was all extremely friendly, and the overall sense of the shop was very comfortable. I can't wait to return and show all my friends this place, I highly recommend this place!

Like the review I wrote yesterday, I wish I could give it three and a half stars, but since I can't it gets four. Why?  Well, they basically do one thing and they do it well--cheesesteak. I got one with provolone and raw onions and it was really great--real steak, a little light on the cheese but not too bad, and just the right about of chopped onions. The bread was soft and tasty also, obviously freshly baked. Yes, I know provolone and raw onions is heresy to someone from Philly, but since I'm from Indiana I don't care. Cheese wiz? You can have it. Anyway, with real cheese these things are good. As a bonus, they offer three types of peppers in the condiment bar, which put the place over the top for me. I'll leave it to others to judge the "genuine" Philly style sandwich.   Service was also good and friendly, and the place is as clean as anyplace I've been. The only complaint I have is it is a little expensive. I spent a little over $11 for a large sandwich and a coke with no sides. Also, if you don't like cheesesteak you're kind of out of luck. But what they do they do very well. I'll certainly be back. The only reason I would have given it three and a half rather than four stars is because of the price.   And those four and five star reviews I've been writing? I promised myself I would only write about restaurants I have eaten at since I started writing these reviews. I promise when I eat at a bad restaurant I won't mince words! I have a whole bunch in mind, but I want to wait and give them another chance.

I remember going into Forefathers the first day they were open. The owner still recognizes me when I go in. Gotta love a family owned business turning out the best product n the city and doing well. This place sells itself but in case you are in doubt about the best Philly Cheese Steak in the city, take the Pepsi challenge you will become a believer.

So I have to say I've been working next to this restaurant for almost a year and have only had the salads which are soooo good!  I had a client in my chair (I'm a stylist) and she said they had the best cheese steaks. So on my break I decided to go have lunch! I got the cheese wiz cheese steak added  onion and peppers. OMG! SOOOOOO GOOD! The employees here are super friendly everytime I have gone.  If you haven't tried it you should definitely go here!  Also super fast!

The Cheesesteak Saga continues...  I had given up on Forefathers after a visit about a year ago resulted in a greasy steak with sparse, over flavored meat. But a recent return trip was better and showed why so many like the place.  A decent steak. I like the cheese options, as only tourists go for wiz. Provolone is the tip.   Meat was overall pretty good quality, though like many local sandwich places, there's not enough of it. They still over season. Good steak doesn't need to hide behind black pepper.  Serving peppers on the side is a nice touch. Found the fries, both traditional and sweet potato, to be good. Nothing remarkable.  Place is a little pricey compared to some competitors, but in all, a pretty good option for a displaced cheesesteak lover.

Went here for lunch to get a cheesesteak and it was fantastic.  Lightly buttered, toasted, soft bun, and plenty of meat, onions, mushrooms, and green peppers on top.  If you don't want cheese wiz then you can get it with provolone or mozzarella... but the wiz is what makes it!  It's not overly oily or greasy, and really hits the spot when you're craving a cheesesteak.  Make sure you get some of their fry sauce, which is just a variation of thousand island dressing (but is so good).  At this price point you could probably get something a little healthier and tastier, but when you want one, you want one, and this is the place to get it.  Check it out!

really really good.  Quick, efficient service, lots of options.  Counter staff didn't mind stupid questions (what is fry sauce?) Excellent sandwich, lots of lean flavorful meat, served on a really great roll.

First time today and I'm with it... I had the cheesesteak with American peppers and onions and fry sauce and I wasn't disappointed. They're could've been a little more meat on it if there was one downfall I felt like there was a lot of bites of mostly bread and no meat but it was still very good. Staff was mostly in the back besides for when I ordered and weren't very outgoing but weren't rude either so I can't complain I will definitely be back when I'm craving a cheesesteak. The $9 price tag for a regular cheesesteak seems a little high though

I got a cheesesteak with provolone, peppers, onions, and mushrooms. It was really good! The fries are crispy, which was good news. They seem to make a big deal about the Fry Sauce but it was pretty basic. Overall, I would recommend this place and definitely see myself going back.
I liked this place.  Next time I go back, I won't ask for cheese-whiz on my Philly.  Also, I'll pass on the iced coffee which is way too sweet for my tastes.

Honestly the best cheesesteak outside of Philadelphia!! Even better than a lot of those in Philadelphia!   Every time I come here I intend on getting a regular size but always end up ordering a large instead. The cheesesteaks and fries are amazing!!! This place is always between steady and busy as far as customer traffic goes, but they always serve up a perfect cheesesteak pretty fast!   If you want a great cheesesteak come here! I guarantee you will keep coming back! So addicting!!!

Super friendly staff and service. Consistent hot and fresh cheesesteaks! Fries are amazing! I've been going here for 3 years and nothing has changed for the worse. Clean establishment, they obviously take pride in everything they do.
Nice clean restaurant and really good cheesesteaks.  Good variety on the menu between cheesesteaks and chickencheesesteak sandwiches.  Consistenly good.
The place to go for as close to Philly as you can get in AZ.  Everything is perfect about their cheesesteak including the whiz

We ate lunch here a few days ago, and loved it. Big cheese steak lovers in my family, so we are pretty picky. Had mine with provalone cheese and it was so good. Also got the spicy blue cheese on top which was  great. Prices are a little high ($11 for a large amd $8 for a regular) but well worth it every once in a while if you are craving meat. Will return.

Wonderful place. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Small menu but several options for cheese which I enjoy. Not everyone wants cheez wiz. They also offer chicken, not just steak as well as salads. They always ask if peppers, onions, and mushrooms are okay, and you can decline some or all of them. A little pricey for a sandwich if you want a combo. About $12-13 if you get the regular size with fries and a drink. They do offer "free" drinks with purchase of fries but I think the best way to go is to get the mini combo if you want more than just a sandwich. Still one of my go to places. Will be back and highly recommend. Also they offer outdoor seating :)

If this place was any closer to my house, I'd weigh twice as much. If you're not a vegetarian, give this place a shot. Just do it.   I was introduced to this place many years ago when I worked in the area and would come by periodically for lunch. As much as I love cheesesteaks, man cannot live on cheesesteak alone... though a good argument could be made that a cheesesteak is a balanced meal: meat, dairy (cheese), grain (bread) and veggies (peppers). Maybe get a salad and skip the fries to balance it out a little more :)  I am not from Philly, nor do I know what a "real" Philly steak looks like, but these guys know how to make a grilled shaved steak sandwich. The beef is cooked perfectly (a good amount of "drip," not dried out) and the bread is really fresh. Even if I were thinking about cutting back on carbs, I'd have to make an exception for their bread. The portions are large enough that the "regular" sandwich is more than I really need to eat, but not so much that I have leftovers.   I got my sandwich with Provolone this time. It was OK. I usually get the Whiz and recommend that with peppers and mushrooms. Whatever you do, don't leave the cheese off; that's an abomination.   :D

This place makes my heart happy!! This is the best place to get a good Philly cheesesteak sandwich. They also have better sweet potato fries than anywhere in town. Don't forget the fry sauce! It's amazing!

Ordered a cheesesteak with onions and Wiz and fries. Everything was pretty good. Would have been better if I wasn't an idiot who got lost on the way there and left my order sitting for so long but that's my fault, not theirs. I'm sure I will be back. Also, the large sandwich is huge, my coworker thought I ordered more than one.

Some of the best cheesesteaks in AZ hands down! I've been to a couple places and they are good but these are on a night level. Plus their customer service in always on point. Go try them out ASAP. You won't be disappointed.

Forefathers is decent. I had a regular steak (low carb style) with a side of cheese fries. It's a bit pricy but it is a good amount of food. Overall came out to about $14 for my meal which came with a drink. The atmosphere is very casual and the food was ready very quickly.  The food however was just too salty. The best part was the sweet potato fries. They were delicious. I didn't finish my cheese fries though just because they cheese was too salty. Again, it was a good experience but I probably wouldn't go back.
Cheesesteak with cheese wiz and all the fixings was interesting and pretty good.   Recommend giving this place a try.
Great food. The sweet potato fries are excellent like other Yelpers pointed out. I got the steak philly with cheese whiz. Thumbs up from me.

And so... I was born and raised in Philadelphia, so I'm skeptical when anyone tells me, ""This is the best cheesesteak outside of Philly. No really!  Trust me". It usually turns out to be a hot roast beef sandwich with kraft singles.   Alas, a coworker told me about Forefathers, to which my skepticism stayed high, that is until I walked in. There on the wall was a picture of Pat's, Geno's, and Jim's. And in that moment, I understood the name.   With a twinge in my heart for my beloved city, although I love Phoenix, it will never compare to Philadelphia. I walked to order and saw cheez wiz on the menu board. Impressive thus far, but signs and menu boards do not a cheesesteak make.   I ordered.  I smelled the onions.  I saw the rolls on the counter. I saw an order that looked like "the best cheesesteak outside of Philly. No really!  Trust me."  I ate.  I cried. (Ok, not really but...)  Pros: Thinly chopped steaks, not sliced beef. If you don't know the difference, then F YOU.   Chucks of onions, not sliced. Cheez wiz!    Cons: Not enough salt.  Good rolls. Not Amoroso or Sarcone, but good.   Thanks, Forefathers. You've restored my faith in humanity.  Yo!
Been here  twice now since we moved here D licious! Clean, fast , friendly! The blue cheese dip is to die for Good job

Simply put this place has the best Cheesesteak sandwiches in town !!! Oh and it comes with great customer service as well. My only dilemma is trying to figure out which one I want, steak or chicken !!

I'm not sure about all the love of this place.  It was good but I'm very surprised that this many people enjoyed it.  The bread was good and the fact that they have Wiz is great but the steak itself was just decent.  I mostly gave them 4 stars because of their selections and options.  Chicken option, provolone option, Wiz option, salads, etc.  That's pretty awesome if you ask me. Was it the best cheese steak ever?  No.  Was it better than Corleones? YES.

I have visited this place many times since my move to Arizona. This is the place to go if you ever are in the mood for a cheesesteak sandwich. You can get it anyway you want it:  chicken or steak, with or without onions, bell peppers, mushrooms, and your choice of cheese. If you decide to get fries or even the sweet potato fries, be sure to get their special fry sauce to dip them! It's pretty good!  And what I love about this place is that their cheesesteaks is that there's not a lot of grease as you would imagine there would be - it's quite opposite, so you don't wind up with soggy gross bread!   Anywho....go check them out!

We were sitting at home this Saturday night watching the Travel Channel and Pat and Gino's was on. Immediately I was home sick (PA girl here) and suddenly hungry. I Googled Philly Cheesesteaks in Arizona and Forefathers came up, even better it was less than 5 minutes from our house. I saw they closed at 8 and it was already 7:30, we grabbed the keys and off we went. When we got there a table of 12 was finishing up as well as another of 2, 3 people came in behind us so we did not feel too bad being late comers. We were pleasantly welcomed by the staff and ordered our food. A few more patrons would trickle in both to dine and get take out. My husband and I both agreed our sandwiches were delicious. He got the original with cheez-wiz and peppers and I had the cheesesteak with onion and american. I thought it was nice that they came out in the dining room to ask how it was, a few people even came in at 8:02 and they we more than happy to serve them unlike other places that will turn you away 5-10 before closing. We will defitnitley be back, I am anxious to try the pizza steak on my next go around. Glad to have found you!

This place ruined my life: I'm from out of state and visiting friends here in Tempe and now I won't be able to have this every day like I'm going to want to. Two words: CHEESE WHIZ. Only got the cheese steak (no sides or dessert) and I'm already craving another (...it's only been a few minutes since I've finished eating). The service was great and the cheese steaks were done quickly - I got the white American with the extra drizzle of cheese whiz and it was amazing. They have a fridge full of extra peppers which I was tempted to just sit and eat (dipped in their house fry sauce stuff - also amazing). Go here. Eat everything. Thank me later.  Update: had to come back (even though I just ate it yesterday) - came during lunch rush, still super speedy and delicious. Added cheese fries this time and they were also perfect. Cheesesteak-wise the large is about two regular sizes put together which you could split (for those budget conscious folks like myself).

Forefathers is truly an American establishment in my opinion due to that they serve cheesesteaks as ordered by the customer. I do recommend to first experience their original Steak Cheesesteak with Wiz and grilled onions to base your experience before creating your science experiments.
Great cheesesteak! Combination of Pabst and cheesesteak would've been awesome if they offered it in the menu..that's just my suggestion for the owner :-)

As a Philadelphia native, finding a local cheesesteak place is tough... this place is pretty darn close... whether for lunch or dinner, always consistent... worth the minimal price for extra meat... awesome side sauce for sweet potato fries... the fact that this place is always busy is a good sign... very helpful and cheerful staff!

I ordered my all time favorite, steak and chicken, WIZ (a must for a genuine philly), and provolone, peppers, onions, and marinara. My childhood favorite I made working as a cook in Pennsylvania, and it was just as good as back home. Made my day, to finally find a good cheese steak in arizona, after 13 years here. Really great service, over all really stoked, and will be back.

Best damn Cheesesteak I've ever encountered! I'm no expert but the cheese wiz (which I would never normally try) is a must! If I could stay fit and eat these delicious pieces of heaven everyday I would! Worth the cheat day meal

I can't stop going here. There isn't a better place in town for quality and value. A meal should cost $15 of this quality and I pay $10.88 every time and never eat it all.  Reg steak cheesesteak w/ Wiz, add "OMG" and buffalo sauce (which are both free to add FYI) and fried (best fries in town) you get a drink free with that for $10.88. And all you can get FRY SAUCE which you can't get anywhere except Utah and Idaho - this place needs to expand to where I live :)

Been here twice.. both times got the cheesesteak with mozzarella and sweet potato fries. The sandwich is very good and you can choose your type of cheese and if you want peppers mushrooms and onions or not. The sweet potato fries are great as are the regular ones (okay I may have stole a few of my friend's fries when they weren't looking. The fry sauce is bomb and I will be back.
Great place for a delicious cheesesteak!!! My only recommendation is to toast the bread first to give a little of a crisp!
This place is the best in AZ, hands down.. no comparison.  great size steak sandwiches...  Will definitely be back!

T'was a good lunch. Got the cheesesteak OMG + whiz and tomato bisque. Came during lunch peak but service was still fast and made  to order. Sandwich packed with meat and veggies came out hot and seasoned well. The bisque was thick and creamy. All in all $12. A bit steep but okay once in a while.   While great tasting, can't imagine eating this all the time and staying slim. Will be back when craving something hearty and hefty.

I've been here a handful of times and have left happy each and every time. I get the steak cheesesteak with cheese whiz and fries. I love getting the fry sauce.   Service: very accommodating, they greet you right away, and check on you after you get your food.   Decor: very nice with lots of seating. Bathrooms are amazing and always clean.   5/5 stars and would recommend trying this!

I love this place!!  It is close to work and I have been going there for years.  The food and service is consistently good.  I like how you can see them making your food and the employees are always working hard. It's pricy at $9 for a regular sandwich but for good quality I'll pay it.

This place has great cheesesteak!! Good portion sizes. The sweet potato fries were so crispy and delicious. And the fry sauce is amazing!! Such good flavor here. And I love that you can get a low carb bowl!! Totally worth the money, although it is a little on the pricier side. But their mini portion is more than enough for lunch. So I liked that deal cuz I got fries, a drink and cheese steak bowl for $8. Not too bad!
Excellent cheese steak anyway you want it. Order fries extra crispy they are killer.

Forefathers is definitely our new regular treat. From "one nation under God" at the door, to the "Ultimate Sacrifice" wall, everything about this neighborhood spot represents the awesomeness of America. The awesomeness of opportunity, capital and making a kick ass cheesesteak thats better than any other west of the Mississippi River.

Excellent! Tried Forefathers for the first time today and was impressed. Went for the beef with onions and Cheese Whiz. The bread was fresh and a great texture, the beef was cooked right with no "mystery meat" and the large size was certainly large. The cheese fries were fresh and cooked great as well. The only complaint I'd have wasn't the food, but the fact that even though it was an off time on a Saturday the dining room wasn't clean with trash on the floor and only a couple table tops not in need of wiping. But that has never stopped me from jamming my face with cheesy meaty goodness, so I'll definitely be back.

I was so happy with my choice of cheese whiz over provolone.  Normally I love provolone, but my husband ordered his cheesesteak with provolone and it was lacking in flavor.  If you ask me, the whiz makes the cheesesteak.  Try the sweet potato fries with their house sauce.

Now this place is sooooooooo good.  The flavor, the meat, the quality of the bread is so fresh and soft, the fries cooked perfectly and that fry sauce is pure heaven.  Really good service as well.  I don't think there is a better cheesesteak in the valley.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because it is really expensive.  I think it was $14 or $15 for a cheesesteak and fries and a drink. If I were to bring my family here it would be about $60 bucks for a family of four....not ideal for cheesesteaks.  Other than that it was really really yum
Finally, a decent cheesesteak! If they had birch beer we might be talkin five star territory. But as is, good steaks and fries for this far west.

I've only been here once, before a night out on mill, and It was good, but I was expecting to like It more. Don't get me wrong, It was really good, but don't you hate It when u eat, then your thirsty, so your drinking glasses full to ease the thirsty-ness,then you get even thirsty-er, so you drink more, and It just gets worse and worse until your so full you can't drink anymore!!!!! But your still thirsty!!!! No? Just me? Ugh, I digress!.. While I was here It got pretty busy and loud, which I didn't mind at all. I like the atmosphere and really liked the cheesesteaks. It was pretty huge, and the fries with cheese sauce were really good! I would come back here, but maybe not right before a night out, I'm pretty sure with all the water I drank I looked about 6 months prego!! :)

I've had a few cheese steaks in my time and while this one isn't bad, it just doesn't impress, especially for the price.  I ended up over $10 and didn't even get fries.  It just seems like this should be a $6.50 meal and that's the only reason it gets there instead of four stars.  The staff is friendly (ironic that you can't call this authentic, getting one in Philly will be more abrupt) and fast.  The various pepper selections are nice, turns out jalapeños are a welcome addition to a cheese steak.  Overall though, I just have to come back to price.  A cheese steak with fries and a drink will set you back $14!  I can find solid lunch any time for less than $10.

My husband said "best cheese steak he's ever had". We were both born and raised in south Jersey just 20 minutes outside of Philly. We have eaten plenty of cheesesteaks and tried lots of places that claim to be "Philly authentic". We dined inside the restaurant on a Thursday around 2pm. The atmosphere and decor inside is very modern and clean. Very welcoming and comfortable. The guy who took our order was super friendly and helpful. The food came out fast and they offer sides like try sauce and peppers out in the dining area so you can go back for more at any time. The food was delicious! Everything was hot and cooked to perfection. We will definitely be back every time we are in the area (it is less than a mile from Ikea).

My husband is a huge fan of cheesesteaks and I never really have been.  After eating at this place, I can finally understand why he loves cheesesteaks so much.    We came here after reading the reviews on Yelp, of course.  It's a small place with sufficient seating (outdoor seating also).  Very clean inside.  The employees are friendly and do not rush you with your order.  After eating at a different cheesesteak place, I had become weary of ordering whiz on my sandwich.  My husband bit the bullet and decided to try it, however, and after taking a bite of his, I wish I had did the same!  Their whiz is not that crap you find in a jar on the shelf in Walmart.  It has flavor and it compliments their cheesesteaks amazingly!  I had my cheesesteak with mozzarella or provolone (whichever is on the menu.. it's been a couple months since trying this place and I'm just now finding time to write up the review).  The cheesesteak is delicious by itself, but I definitely would have liked the whiz better.  These sandwiches are HUGE.  Glad I ordered the smaller one, because there's no way I could have eaten all of mine by myself.  Considering the cost, the portions are great!  Their fries were awesome, as well.  Next time, we'll try the sweet potato variety.  Never been a huge fan of them, because nobody can seem to make them taste good, but this place won't let me down, I'm sure! :)  If you like cookies -- grab a cookie from there!  They seem to be fresh baked and made in-house.  I could be wrong about that, but either way they are damn good!  Will be going back when we wander out that way again.  Will definitely be a staple destination spot anytime we find ourselves needing to go to IKEA, since it's nearby. :)

YUMMMMMM!!!! I was brought to this place by a friend and was so glad to find it! Very clean and unique casual setting. Staff were very friendly, food was hot, fresh and amazingly gooy...definately a 4+ napkin kind of meal. So happy to see they serve Chicken philly -steak as well as the usual philly cheese steak and sweet potatoe fries! Find out where this place is because it could be easily over looked and you would be missing out on some deeee-licous food. This place is a must try!

This place is a favorite of mine. Authentic cheesesteak sandwiches at a reasonable price. They also have fry sauce!! If you are not familiar with fry sauce, get familiar!  Great location, always busy, but that is a good thing! I'm just glad it's not closer to my home, I'd be fat...ter.
Prices are a bit high. The sandwiches are mediocre at best. The funny part is that they don't give military discounts. I don't quite understand why there's pictures of cows on the wall.

This place is amazing. The food is absolutely delicious, I usually get the cheese steak with cheese whiz, onions and mushrooms. I go with my husband on his lunch break and we usually hit the lunch rush, but they are extremely fast at getting food out! I can't say enough good things about this place :)

3.5 stars!  Came here on whim when this other cheesesteak spot we wanted to try out was closed for the day.  We had a long day of furniture shopping ahead of us and we needed to fill our tummies.  Enter Forefathers!  The establishment itself is very clean and modern.  The staff was patient while we studied the menu and they seemed like a happy bunch.  I had ordered a regular cheesesteak  provolone and some plain crispy fries .  I almost regret not getting it with Cheez Whiz and OMG style but I figured I didn't need all that cheese filling me up and onions and peppers just didn't draw me in.  I did end up having to dump some fry sauce into my cheesesteak after the provolone got cold and it became a bit dry to eat.  I think this sandwich had great flavor and it's pretty hefty and filling.  The price is a bit steep but you do get a lot of meat [although not fresh].  It's a solid and decent cheesesteak.

HOLY MOSES. I went here for lunch on the advice of my co-worker and I am so stoked I did.  Being Deaf, I am sometimes wary of ordering in loud places, and although Forefathers wasn't exceptionally loud, there was enough noise that I struggled with ordering and hearing. The guy taking my order was super nice and very understanding, he even wrote out what I ordered to make sure it was correct (HUGE BROWNIE POINTS FOR CUSTOMER SERVICE THERE... THAT GUY SHOULD GET A RAISE). My food only took about 5 minutes to get to me, and by the time I had filled my drink and gotten together napkins (which were REALLY, REALLY needed), it was ready.  I got the mini cheesesteak with provolone, onions, green peppers, and mushrooms, mini fries, a cookie, and a drink - all for $8.30. The roll was soft and delicious, and the meat & veggies were unbelievably flavorful. The cookie was just as amazing as the other reviews said it would be - gooey and chewy on the inside. The mini meal was the perfect size for lunch, and even then I couldn't finish all of the fries.  Be advised: you WILL need like 500 napkins, moist towelettes, and possibly a shower after eating their cheesesteaks: SUPER messy, but SO worth it. I recommend this place without hesitation for their excellent customer service, clean restaurant, freakin delicious food, and awesome set up.

Voted #1 Philly In Arizona, by me. Trust me, I'm a connoisseur of Philly Cheesesteaks.  I've tried them everywhere you can think of in Arizona; if it's offered on the menu-I've had it.  Most places are really terrible at making them.  Forefathers is different.  They used the right cut of steak, the required white american cheese, onions and peppers.  They even had pickled cherry peppers-this was a strong indicator to me that they were going to be genuine! To top it all off, they had Fry sauce with their delicious and crispy french fries! Fry sauce is uncommon in AZ, so this was a total win.  I will be back, often. Great work people of Forefathers!

Wow this place is amazing. The food is incredible and the staff are super friendly and professional. My wife and I agree they serve up the best Philly cheesesteaks we've ever had. I love the fry sauce and my wife adored their sweet potato fries.   The prices are high but it is totally worth it. If you are in the mood for a great Philly cheesesteak, this is the place to go. I can't wait to go back!!!
Really good flavors the only reason I'm not giving a 5 star is it was a little to salty for my liking but awesome place will definitely comeback!!

This has become a regular stop on my way to and from Tucson. Both my fiancé and I think it's the best cheesesteaks this side of the Mississippi. You will pay a gourmet price for a truly gourmet meal; this does not stop us. Though the menu is limited, they aspire to make what they offer amazing. The staff is very friendly and offer great advice if you're just not sure what to get. You cannot go wrong with a regular steak sandwich with provolone or mozzarella, an order of fries with a drink. If you're looking for a lighter side of things, the salads are equally as good. I recommend this place to everyone that finds themselves in the area. We will be back, many tines more.

This place by far beats Uncle Sam's in regards to the cheese they use, meats and peppers. The sandwiches are a really good size and I usually get a couple meals from each one. The staff is always friendly and service is prompt. Never had a bad experience here and highly recommend going if you want a great meal.
This place was very clean and service was great! The cashier had a great attitude and seemed like he loved his job!! Also the food was very food my girlfriend and I will be definitely coming back!!

After reading the reviews and hearing some word of mouth I finally had a chance to check out Forefathers.  It's umm, not rad.  It's not terrible either, but I would definitely drive several miles past it for Uncle Sam's or Corleone's.  For my money it's about a half a star above The Steak Escape or some similar abomination.

First things first, I did not get a cheesesteak.  In all honesty, I have no idea what possessed me and caused me to order what I did.  The BBQ Chicken Cheesesteak is a beastly concoction.  You get fresh bread slathered with wiz, loaded with barbecued chicken, and then topped with coleslaw.  Of course I added bacon too.  When we got our food I kind of stared at it for a while.  I wasn't sure what to do with it.  How was I supposed to pick it up?  That would just be lame.  Ready with an arsenal of wet naps in my purse, I dug in to the most precarious food eating situation I have ever found myself in.  The first bite left me drooling wiz.  The second bite had coleslaw covering my hands.  The third bite had chicken falling out.  You get the idea?  It was messy and it was wrong.  It was so wrong it was right.  I really dug this weird combination.  The bacon just really pushed the sandwich from great to stellar.  I have to mention that their barbecue sauce is really good!  It's barely sweet, really smokey, and it packs a lot of flavor.  The bottom line is that I really liked this place.  I would like to go back and just try a regular cheesesteak with some fries.  Why fries too?  Because they have FRY SAUCE!  Woot!

I give my 5-star rating solely on the buffalo chicken sandwich.  You will be hard pressed to find another buffalo chicken sandwich that even comes close to matching this one.  The bread is soft and chewy, the sauce is perfection, couple all of that with quality chicken, grilled onions, celery and green peppers, you have yourself a work of art.  The side salad with the fresh made house vinaigrette is a perfect side to the sandwich.  I make sure to come to forefathers a couple times per month.

What should I have for dinner after IKEA?   Friend: "How about Fore fathers?" Me: "What feathers?"  When we pulled up, I was expecting sandwiches similar to subway. I was getting ready to complain until I saw the menu. It was much simpler and less confusing. All you need is to pick is the size of the bread, steaks or chicken, types of cheese you like and all 4 ingredients. Simple! I like!   While I was waiting for my sandwich to go, I peeked around the restaurant. It is small but well organized. Staffs are young but friendly and polite. They have a small refrigerator to keep hot peppers fresh and organized (and clean). I was very impressed. Their ice tea is delicious. They have few tables in the outdoor area if you want to enjoy the beautiful weather of Arizona.  When I got home, I couldn't wait to eat the sandwich. I have to admit that it was very messy and end up eating it folks and knives Lol... it was juicy, meaty and delicious. Neither one of us could finish ours because the meat portion was generous. Their sweet potato fries are definitely sweet and delicious. We couldn't finish all of it and save it in the refrigerator for tomorrow.   Next time when I am in the general area again, I will stop by here for sure.
Overpriced for what you get.  Roll was fair, a little spongy.  Meat was pretty tasteless and an odd texture.  This place would never survive in my native Philadelphia.
